page.title: 01Summary of the Rawmarsh area
page.content: The area is situated to the north- west of Rotherham in the county of South Yorkshire. The highest point in this undulating area is{Hoober Stand (140m) in the north-west and the area is crossed by small streams and gently sloping valleys. The land use is a mixture of urban and rural development which reflects man's use and misuse of the environ- ment for his needs. To the east the housing estates of the suburban fringes of{Rawmarsh} reflect the changing ideas in urban planning, The Dale, Monkwood, Manor Farm and Thorogate. To the west, surrounding the hamlets of Nether Haugh and Hoober, is the parkland of Earl Fitzwilliam's{Wentworth Estate} where opencast mining, agriculture and recreational use have left their mark.
